stepTitle: Suppose a block of ice weighing $$50.0$$ g at a temperature of -5°C is placed in $$500$$ g of water at a temperature of 25°C. Calculate the final temperature after thermal equilibrium is reached, assuming no heat loss to the surroundings. The enthalpy of fusion of ice is $$\Delta H_{fus}$$ $$=$$ $$6.007$$ kJ $${mol}^{-1}$$, and the molar heat capacities c_P​ of ice and water are $$36$$ J °C**-1 $${mol}^{-1}$$ and $$75$$ J °C**-1, respectively.
stepBody: Provide your answer in °C to two decimal places.
